DOC.brief_summary: This study is a clinical trial of moderate sedation with propofol versus moderate sedation with ketamine for procedural sedation in the Emergency Department.
DOC.brief_title: Propofol Versus Ketamine for Moderate Procedural Sedation in the Emergency Department (ED)
DOC.criteria: patients who require moderate procedural sedation with propofol in the ED age > 17 years pregnant intoxicated cannot give informed consent allergy to ketamine or propofol patient will require deep procedural sedation ASA physical status score > 2
DOC.keyword: moderate procedural sedation in the ED
